p: In Africa, dengue is likely to be underreported and under-recognized. This is due to the low awareness of health care providers, and the circulation of other prevalent NMFI [ 5]. The absence of surveillance in many African countries and the lack of effective diagnostic tools also contribute to the underestimation of the real incidence of dengue fever in Africa [ 31]. Since other studies report the expansion of dengue fever among NMFI [ 36], our study and the cited studies in Abidjan and Ibadan stress the need to implement laboratory capacity to assess the real burden of DENV in rural and urban areas of West Africa, during inter epidemic periods.
